posts.description: What the Interviews in Frank Ocean's Magazine Can Tell Us About the Album (and Life Itself) | NOISEY
posts.extended: On Saturday, with no warning, Frank Ocean discreetly opened four pop-up shops around the world hocking his new Boys Don’t Cry project. Instead of the album we had all assumed it was, the project was a 360+ page, oversized, high gloss zine filled with fashion shoots, photography stories and poetry.

posts.description: FBI Authorized Informants to Break the Law 22,800 Times in 4 Years | The Daily Dot
posts.extended: Over a four-year period, the FBI authorized informants to break the law more than 22,800 times, according to newly reviewed documents.

posts.description: Corey Lewandowski Explains Why Trump Doesn’t Go to Black Communities: It Wasn’t a “Safe” Space
posts.extended: Corey Lewandowski may not be on Donald Trump’s campaign team, but that’s not stopping him from defending his former boss.

posts.description: Prominent ‘copwatcher’ accuses NYPD of targeted, unconstitutional arrests | Mo4ch News
posts.extended: LaSalle was copwatching outside the Patterson Houses, a public housing complex in The Bronx managed by the New York City Housing Authority on the night of August 5.
